snippet: The court debate over the new health care law offers yet another example of worrying about imaginary risks.
abstract: Richard H Thaler Economic View column contends the Supreme Court deliberations over the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act offer yet another example of worrying about imaginary risks; opines one pernicious category of such risks involves those created by proponents of the 'slippery slope' arguments; concludes such arguments are dangerous because they are popular, versatile and often convincing--yet completely fallacious.
lead_paragraph: The court debate over the new health care law offers yet another example of worrying about imaginary risks.
